24.series: As Desventuras de Chiquinho) p. 2 in O Tico-tico : Jornal das Crianças, no. 5
notes: Summary (by M. Harbeck): Chiquinho's mother forgets to take off the price tag of a new coat. Chiquinho (Richard Outcault's Buster Brown) keeps it and sticks it back on her coat on Sunday in church. When his mother discovers what he's done he gets a severe punishment, not in public, but inside their coach.
Episode numbered: "V."

96.author: written by Satoru Akahori ; art by Yumisuke Kotoyoshi ; Jeremiah Bourque, translator.
notes: Translation of: Seibâ Marionetto J.
"First published in Japan in 1997 by Kadokawa Shoten."

Summary (from OCLC): On a world with no women, the surviving men have reinvented females in the form of androids called Marionettes. Normal marionettes are built to serve men and are limited in their actions and emotions until a boy named Otaru Mamiya finds a special Saber Marionette named Lime.

120.heading: Mammoth Films.
120.title: Flesh Gordon [videorecording]
120.author: presented by Hen's Tooth Video and by Mammoth Films.
notes: Collector's ed.
1 videocassette (90 min.) : sd., col. ; 1/2 in.
VHS.
First issued 1974 as a motion picture.
Cast: Jason Williams, Suzanne Fields, Joseph Hudgins, William Hunt, John Hoyt as Professor Gordon.

Summary: "In this popular outrageous spoof of sci-fi films, Earth is thrown onto carnal chaos by a mysterious sex ray emanating from outer space. Flesh Gordon, Dale Ardor and their new found friend Dr. Flexi Jerkoff, must travel to the planet Porno to save Earth from certain devastation by the mad Emperor Wang. Includes 10 minutes of previously unseen footage and original trailer.
"This program contains mature subject matter. It is intended for viewing by adult audiences, 18 years and older."

137.heading: Mammy.
137.title: "The Movie Camera"
137.author: [No author]
137.series: Li'l Eight Ball) 6 p. in New Funnies, no. 102
notes: Summary: Eight Ball wants to impress Honeysuckle Jones, and builds a flying model airplane. She puts on a new hat to impress him, but the airplane destroys the hat and she gives him a good beating. Then Mammy sends Eight Ball to watch the store (the Dixieland Newsreel and Snapshot Co. Inc.) while Uncle Washboard has his lunch. A running gun battle goes by in the street, and Eight Ball catches it on Uncle Washboard's movie camera. The crooks are caught and Eight Ball gets a reward, which impresses Honesuckle Jones, and he invites her over for a screen test.

138.heading: Mammy.
138.title: "Outdoor Man"
138.author: [No author]
138.series: Li'l Eight Ball) 6 p. in New Funnies, no. 98
notes: Summary: Honeysuckle Jones says Eight Ball isn't her type, she wants a tall dark outdoor man who smokes a pipe, like her Uncle Washboard. Both Honeysuckle and Eight Ball try smoking Washboard's pipe, and it makes them sick. The Doctor Killpeeple makes a house call, smells the smoke on Eight Ball's breath, and gets sick himself. Mammy figures out what's going on, apparently decides it's not too serious, and takes the opportunity to give the reluctant doctor some castor oil. Uncle Washboard's wife is named Lily Mae.
